required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of 12-weeks Supplementation of Eubacterium Hallii on Insulin Sensitivity and Glycaemic Control
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Trial to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of 12-weeks Supplementation of Eubacterium Hallii on Insulin Sensitivity and Markers of Glycaemic Control in Healthy Hyperglycaemic Males

brief_summary.textblock: This 12 week placebo-controlled study evaluates the efficacy and safety of E. hallii supplementation.

detailed_description.textblock:
There is an increased awareness that the bacteria which forms our microbiome, plays a crucial role in human health and diseases. Numerous studies have highlighted the therapeutic potential of specific bacteria in preventing and treating metabolic, gastrointestinal and other diseases.
The aim of the study is evaluate the effect of administration of a next generation probiotic, Eubacterium hallii, versus placebo on insulin sensitivity and glycemic control, in volunteers with some markers of metabolic syndrome.
Participants will receive their randomized study product daily for 12 weeks. The target population will be otherwise healthy hyperglycaemic males.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: 2-hour blood glucose incremental Area Under the Curve (AUC)
primary_outcome.description: as measured by standard Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT)
as measured by insulin sensitivity index-OGTT (ISI-OGTT)
Change from baseline to Week 12 in each of the treatment groups as compared to placebo in A1c levels

secondary_outcome.description: as measured by the Professional Continuous Glucose Monitoring (PCGM) device over 10as measured by the PCGM device over 10-14 days at the start and end of intervention
as measured by the PCGM device over 10-14 days at the start and end of intervention
as measured by the PCGM device over 10-14 days at the start and end of intervention
Change from baseline to Week 12 in each of the treatment groups as compared to placebo in fasting blood glucose levels
Change from baseline to Week 12 in Systolic blood pressure (SBP) (mmHg) and diastolic blood pressure (DBP) (mmHg)

other_outcome.description: Change from baseline to Week 12 in the incidence of abnormal laboratory test results
Change from baseline to Week 12 in Heart Rate
Change from baseline to Week 12 in Temperature
Change from baseline to Week 12 in AEs

arm_group.description: 1 capsule per day, consumed orally, before breakfast for the duration of the study.
1 capsule per day, consumed orally, before breakfast for the duration of the study.

intervention.description: Eubacterium hallii, ≥ 1x10^9 live bacterial cells (per capsule)
Placebo capsules are identical to the active treatment
